page.title: 14Religion, Swainby & Potto
page.content: Holy Cross Church,{Swainby,}and Saint Mary's,{Potto,}have a joint electoral roll of 146. Sunday-morning attendance at Parish Communion in Swainby is 45-60, with Sunday School at the same time. Potto has 1 service on Sundays, at 8am, 11am or 6pm, with attendance usually less than 12. Services are taken by the Vicar, non-stipendiary minister or a lay reader, all of whom live in Swainby.{Methodism}in Swainby has dwindled; the congregation now averages 9 or 10. Services, at 2.15pm are taken by Circuit Ministers and local preachers. The chapel is up for sale, with planning permission for a smaller building and some housing on the site. The disused Primitive Methodist chapel was demolished this year.{Ingleby Arncliffe}chapel, built in 1863, has one service on Sundays, a Sunday School and a Youth Club.
